user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 is: The Standard Library function memcmp shall not be used to compare null terminated strings.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of iterate_post:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
iterate_post (void *coninfo_cls, enum MHD_ValueKind kind, const char *key,
              const char *filename, const char *content_type,
              const char *transfer_encoding, const char *data, uint64_t off,
              size_t size)
{
  struct connection_info_struct *con_info = coninfo_cls;
  (void) kind;               /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) filename;           /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) content_type;       /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) transfer_encoding;  /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) off;                /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */

  if (0 == strcmp (key, "name"))
  {
    if ((size > 0) && (size <= MAXNAMESIZE))
    {
      char *answerstring;
      answerstring = malloc (MAXANSWERSIZE);
      if (! answerstring)
        return MHD_NO;

      snprintf (answerstring, MAXANSWERSIZE, GREETINGPAGE, data);
      con_info->answerstring = answerstring;
    }
    else
      con_info->answerstring = NULL;

    return MHD_NO;
  }

  return MHD_YES;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I inspected the provided function for any use of the Standard Library function memcmp (which Rule 21.14 prohibits for comparing null-terminated strings). The code contains no calls to memcmp. The only string comparison present is strcmp (if (0 == strcmp (key, "name"))), which is permitted for null-terminated strings; other standard functions used are malloc and snprintf (no memcmp). Therefore there are no code fragments in this function that violate or require investigation for MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14.
